document.masterDocTitle: New Distributional Records of Cerambycidae (Coleoptera) from Mexico

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New Distributional Records of Cerambycidae (Coleoptera) from Mexico

subSubSection.paragraph:
Axestoleus meridionalis (Bates, 1880)
.
Chiapas : 16 Km O Ocozocoautla, “El Aguacero”, 24-VI- 1995 , Col. V. H. Toledo (1, CUIM). Recorded distribution: Mexico , Guatemala , Nicaragua , and Costa Rica . Previously known from the Mexican states of Oaxaca, Quintana Roo, and Veracruz ( Monné 2015a ; Tavakilian 2015 ).

Crossidius discoideus blandi Casey, 1893
.
Chihuahua: Ojinaga 31 Km W, 28-VIII-1991 , R. Ayala (1, EBCC); 171 Km N de Chihuahua, 29-VIII- 1991 , 1410 m, Col. R. Ayala (3, EBCC). Recorded distribution: USA and Mexico . Previously known from the Mexican states of Baja California , Durango , Zacatecas ( Monné 2015a ; Tavakilian 2015 ).

Elytroleptus immaculipennis Knull, 1935
.
Puebla: vic. Tequitlapa, 19° 08′ 30″ N , 97° 32′ 39″ O ,
2425 m
,
13-VII-2001
, R . L. Westcott , beating fire damaged
Quercus sp.
(2, EBCC ). Recorded distribution: USA and Mexico. Previously known from the Mexican states of Baja California Sur, Durango , and Oaxaca ( Monné 2015a )
.

Elytroleptus similis Chemsak and Linsley, 1965
.
Jalisco : 5 Km SE Cuautla, 29-VI-1995 , Alt. 1610 m , 20° 10′.57 N 98″ N, 104° 19′.54 O, Cols. F. A. Noguera y A. Rodríguez (2, EBCC). Recorded distribution: Mexico from the states of Oaxaca and Puebla ( Monné 2015a ; Tavakilian 2015 ).

Metaleptus angulatus (Chevrolat, 1834)
.
Yucatán: 4 Km S Umán , 28-V-1996 , Col. F. A. Noguera (1, EBCC). Recorded distribution: Mexico to Panama . Previously known from the Mexican states of Chihuahua , Jalisco , Estado de México , and Veracruz ( Monné 2015a ; Tavakilian 2015 ).

Parevander nietii (Guerin-Meneville, 1844)
.
Chiapas : Mpio. Tuxtla Gutiérrez, 3 Km SO Tuxtla Gutiérrez, 5-XI-1974 , C. Lemus (1, ECOSC-E). Recorded distribution: Mexico to Guatemala . Previously known from the Mexican state of Veracruz ( Monné 2015a ; Tavakilian 2015 ).

Pleuromenus baccifer Bates, 1872
.
Veracruz : Est. Biol. de Los Tuxtlas ,
170 m
s.n.m,
21 marzo 1985
, P. Sinaca (1, EBLT );
480 m
s.n.m., El Vigía ,
26 abril 1986
, A. Ibarra (1, EBLT ). Recorded distribution: Mexico to Costa Rica . Previously known from the Mexican states of Hidalgo and Oaxaca (Gutiérrez and Noguera 2015; Monné 2015a )
.

Plionoma suturalis LeConte, 1858
.
Sonora : 13 Km E Navojoa , Microondas Cerro Prieto ,
27-VI- 1995
, alt.
410 m
, 27° 04′ 98″ N, 109° 17′ 32″ O , Col. R . Ayala (1, EBCC ). Recorded distribution: USA and Mexico. Previously known in Mexico from the state of Baja California ( Monné 2015a )
.

Rhodoleptus umbrosus Chemsak and Linsley, 1982
.
Puebla : 6 Km SW Acatepec, 18.13 N - 97.38 W , 17-VII-1996 , CLB:590, 1994 m, leg. C. L. Bellamy (1, EBCC). Recorded distribution: Mexico in the state of Oaxaca ( Monné 2015a ; Tavakilian 2015 ).

Sphaenothecus bilineatus Gory, 1831
.
Hidalgo : Nueva Tenochtitlán ,
21-VII-1999
, Alt.
90 m
, Col. A. M. Corona (1, EBCC ); Km 71 Tampico- Mexico ,
22-VII-1999
, Alt.
1594 m
, 20° 30′ 51″ N , 98° 39′ 28″ O , Col. A. M. Corona (1, EBCC ). Recorded distribution: USA to Honduras . Previously known from the Mexican states of Baja California , Chiapas , Coahuila , Jalisco , Morelos , Oaxaca , and Sonora ( Monné 2015a )
.

Stenaspis verticalis verticalis Audinet-Serville, 1834
.
Hidalgo: 4 Km N Mezquititlán, 11- XI-1991 , alt. 1420 m , Col. F. A. Noguera (1, EBCC). Recorded distribution: USA to Brazil . Previously known from the Mexican states of Durango, Guerrero, Jalisco, Morelos, Puebla, Sonora, and Veracruz ( Monné 2015a ; Tavakilian 2015 ).

Trachyderes ( Dendrobias ) mandibularis mandibularis Dupont
in Audinet-Serville, 1834.
Yucatán: 4 Km S Umán , 28-V-1996 , Col. F. A. Noguera (1, EBCC). Recorded distribution: USA to West Indies and Colombia . Previously known from the Mexican states of Baja California Sur, Chiapas, Ciudad de México (previously Distrito Federal), Durango, Guerrero, Jalisco, Estado de México, Michoacán, Nayarit, Oaxaca, Puebla, Sonora, and Veracruz ( Linsley 1942 ; Monné 2015a ; Tavakilian 2015 ).
